page.title: 02CHANGING TIMES-THE 1930'S
page.content: CHANGING TIMES. THE 1930's. Mr. Clarke Remembers. Mr Clarke started school around 1923. He went to the old village school.In the school they had at least 144 pupils.They sat at big long desks with four to five children.They used slates to write with instead of paper.Only the top class used pen and inK.They stayed at the junior school until they were 14years old.If you got a scholarship you could go to the grammer school or if your parents could afford it they could pay to go.You had to be quite clever to earn a scholarship. In the 1930's there were many trademan like blacksmith,butchers,bakers,tailors,whe elwrights,cartright,coffinmaker, carenters, and springmakers .
